channel.title: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
channel.description:
Hi,
I would like to redirect some browsing experience through my whonix gateway. I don't quite understand the different topic in help and in the forum which have been open and "before tor", "after tor" and the transparent proxy. So if I understood the proxy topic well, there is a proxy integrated in the tor "server" of the whonix gateway? How would I activate the access to this proxy, to have the browser redirected to the whonix gateway?
I'm used to the split dns and to redirect the browser traffic to my vpn. I imagine I could connect to the tor instance from whonix gateway through a port, but should I activate something in the tor configuration? Have I to open a rule in the firewall from whonix gateway?
If someone could clarify some points, that would be nice because it's really dark for me ...

item.title: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
item.dc:creator: boistordu
item.description:
yes, so diverting browsing traffic through 9150 sock5 works perfectly. thanks

Read full topic

item.title: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
item.dc:creator: boistordu
item.description:
for the explanation of split tunneling.

Mullvad VPN

Split tunneling with Mullvad VPN - Guides | Mullvad VPN

Here is a guide that will help you set up split tunneling.

and yes I think that’s what I meant with your example with thunderbird. I will try and tell you.

I know this is not the go-to system of doing things but it’s practical when you don’t have enough RAM to run multiple instance. or just a specific tab you want or website run through tor in place of using tor browser or brave

Read full topic
item.source: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy

item.title: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
boistordu:

So not redirecting the whole traffic and certainly not making this my primary connection.

Well, if you don’t want all traffic through Tor, then that’s besides the point of Whonix. In that case it would be unsupported.

Whonix

Unsupported

What do you mean by unsupported?

Why not use Multiple Whonix-Workstations? Why mix it into one? Some could be configured to always go user -> Tor -> destination, others to be user -> Tor -> VPN or proxy whatever you envision.

Whonix

Multiple Whonix-Workstations

Compartmentalization. Better separation of different tasks and/or pseudonyms by using multiple Whonix-Workstations.

You want at the same time:

a) user -> Tor -> destination
b) user -> VPN -> destination OR
c) user -> proxy -> destination

from within the same VM?

boistordu:

So if I understood the proxy topic well, there is a proxy integrated in the tor “server” of the whonix gateway?

Whonix-Gateway is a Tor proxy, i.e. it routes all traffic over Tor. Traffic from VMs connected to Whonix-Gateway can either talk to a Tor TransPort, DnsPort or SocksPort.

No other proxy involved.

boistordu:

I’m used to the split dns

What is split DNS?

boistordu:

I imagine I could connect to the tor instance from whonix gateway through a port

Well, for example Mozilla Thunderbird with TorBirdy connects to Whonix-Gateway IP 10.152.152.10 on port 9102 where a Tor SocksPort is open. Not sure if that is what you meant. More on IPs and ports:

Whonix

Stream Isolation

Prevent Identity Correlation through Circuit Sharing by using Tor Stream Isolation

boistordu:

Have I to open a rule in the firewall from whonix gateway?

Very very few use cases for that. Use with care.

boistordu:

but should I activate something in the tor configuration?

Usually not required. Enough pre-configured Tor ports. ( https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation )

boistordu:

is it this to add to the configuration file to activate the proxy?

No.

boistordu:

“before tor”, “after tor”

That is explained here:

Whonix

Tunnels/Introduction

Instructions on how to combine tunnels (VPN, SSH, proxy) with Tor. (User -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Internet) (User -> proxy/VPN/SSH ->...

“before tor”, “after tor” are ambiguous terminology. Better use style like
User -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Tor -> destination
etc.

Read full topic
item.source: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy

item.title: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
item.dc:creator: boistordu
item.description:
is it this to add to the configuration file to activate the proxy?

Whonix

Whonix-Gateways Own Traffic Transparent Proxy

Getting Transparent Proxying working for Whonix-Gateway's own traffic.

Read full topic
item.source: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy

item.title: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
item.dc:creator: boistordu
item.description:
maybe I wasn’t clear enough.
I’ve done that, but that’s just to add and to connect the network card to the internal network that creates whonix gateway.
But as I pointed, I want to able to use it like I do with split tunneling vpn. So not redirecting the whole traffic and certainly not making this my primary connection.
So for my split tunneling vpn installation I have my openvpn connection and the vpn provider has a proxy server to make the traffic you decide redirected through the vpn through sock5 or other proxy … So how is that possible with whonix gateway? And it’s not on the page you linked but thanks for that that’s how I got the network set up.

Read full topic
item.source: connecting a windows vm to whonix-gateway through proxy
